GOD.content: literature, place of secrets w/out secrecy, all these crypts w/out depth, no other basis than abyss of call or address; only law: singularity of event called the work (l’oeuvre)
GOD.linkedContent: literature, place of secrets w/out secrecy, all these crypts w/out depth, no other basis than abyss of call or address; only law: singularity of event called the work (l’oeuvre)

MC.content: [artist as pervert?] art (particularly literature) can isolate performatively its own context for its own event > the “oeuvre”
MC.linkedContent: [artist as pervert?] art (particularly literature) can isolate performatively its own context for its own event > the “oeuvre”

MC.content: this large, stereotomic margin of play is perhaps largest of all (during certain history) but not infinite [?] [see also Christianity/Capitalism not infinite]
MC.linkedContent: this large, stereotomic margin of play is perhaps largest of all (during certain history) but not infinite [?] [see also Christianity/Capitalism not infinite]

BL.content: work, opus, does not belong to field, transforms it
BL.linkedContent: work, opus, does not belong to field, transforms it

MSUBJ.content: motion of motif, w/out totalization, subjectilian wall: “of this dissociation in the body of which there will always be marked the singularity of the event made work”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: motion of motif, w/out totalization, subjectilian wall: “of this dissociation in the body of which there will always be marked the singularity of the event made work”

P.content: reserve, savings, stock: self-protection of the work (ergon), binding (Verbindung) of energy, condition for “mastery” of pleasure-principle
P.linkedContent: reserve, savings, stock: self-protection of the work (ergon), binding (Verbindung) of energy, condition for “mastery” of pleasure-principle

PS.content: [madness (outside of work) as clinical; work as critical]
Artaud howls under headings: existence, flesh, life, theater, cruelty > promising an art prior to madness & work
PS.linkedContent: Artaud howls under headings: existence, flesh, life, theater, cruelty > promising an art prior to madness & work

PS.content: Artaud’s resistance to clinical/critical exegeses: protest itself against exemplification itself > destroy history of dualist metaphysics, render doctor/critic helpless: art w/out works, language w/out trace
PS.linkedContent: Artaud’s resistance to clinical/critical exegeses: protest itself against exemplification itself > destroy history of dualist metaphysics, render doctor/critic helpless: art w/out works, language w/out trace

PS.content: for Artaud, God is false value of initial worth of what is born: this false value becomes Value, for it doubled what never existed > the work (excrement) repeats this theft, steals another part of me [dispossessing my nonexistent ur-value prior to exiting the Orifice]
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, God is false value of initial worth of what is born: this false value becomes Value, for it doubled what never existed > the work (excrement) repeats this theft, steals another part of me [dispossessing my nonexistent ur-value prior to exiting the Orifice]

PS.content: for Artaud, “the metaphor of myself is my dispossession w/in language” > this by way of the counterfeiter, God–Satan, who isn’t a creator, but the subject of all [dispossessing] oeuvres
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, “the metaphor of myself is my dispossession w/in language” > this by way of the counterfeiter, God–Satan, who isn’t a creator, but the subject of all [dispossessing] oeuvres

PS.content: work as shit, we shit the glue of minds, pure body doesn’t shit
PS.linkedContent: work as shit, we shit the glue of minds, pure body doesn’t shit

PS.content: [proper: man close to himself; abject: the work]
like excrement, like turd, a metaphor of the penis, the work should stand up
PS.linkedContent: like excrement, like turd, a metaphor of the penis, the work should stand up

PS.content: Derrida shows in Nietzsche & Hölderlin an equation btwn dancing, standing upright, and the work itself
PS.linkedContent: Derrida shows in Nietzsche & Hölderlin an equation btwn dancing, standing upright, and the work itself

PS.content: but, unlike Artaud, they treat erection metaphorically, it doesn’t exile itself into the work, expatriate itself to sovereignty of speech/writing, uprightness of letter, the tip of the pen
PS.linkedContent: but, unlike Artaud, they treat erection metaphorically, it doesn’t exile itself into the work, expatriate itself to sovereignty of speech/writing, uprightness of letter, the tip of the pen

PS.content: does Nietzsche question relation of grammatical security & uprightness of letter?
PS.linkedContent: does Nietzsche question relation of grammatical security & uprightness of letter?

PS.content: Heidegger foretells this relationship: Greeks interpret language visually, as grammata, in writing language comes to stand (paradoxically, this confirms disdain of writing in Phaedrus)
PS.linkedContent: Heidegger foretells this relationship: Greeks interpret language visually, as grammata, in writing language comes to stand (paradoxically, this confirms disdain of writing in Phaedrus)

PS.content: Artaud wanted to destroy [this] metaphor: the standing upright as metaphorical erection in written work
PS.linkedContent: Artaud wanted to destroy [this] metaphor: the standing upright as metaphorical erection in written work

PS.content: man as the scato-theological being (this is the essence of guilt), capable of being soiled by the work and thieving God > God is a sin agains the unnameable Divine
PS.linkedContent: man as the scato-theological being (this is the essence of guilt), capable of being soiled by the work and thieving God > God is a sin agains the unnameable Divine

PS.content: madness as reduction of work (l’oeuvre) and difference, inalienable life; other madness: metaphysics that lives w/in difference (alienation) > madness is the work or the absence of it
PS.linkedContent: madness as reduction of work (l’oeuvre) and difference, inalienable life; other madness: metaphysics that lives w/in difference (alienation) > madness is the work or the absence of it

FS.content: structuralism & literary criticism (structuralist in essence/destiny), lapse of attention paid to force (the tension of force itself) > even take revenge on force by declaring separation the condition of the work
FS.linkedContent: structuralism & literary criticism (structuralist in essence/destiny), lapse of attention paid to force (the tension of force itself) > even take revenge on force by declaring separation the condition of the work

FS.content: for Blanchot, pure absence, the excess of everything—possibility of writing (absence of everything in which presence is announced) > makes one work
FS.linkedContent: for Blanchot, pure absence, the excess of everything—possibility of writing (absence of everything in which presence is announced) > makes one work

FS.content: [for deconstruction] history of the work is not only its past, it is the impossibility of the text ever being present > legitimating intention keeps to internal truth, avoids thinking a subjective origin that is not simply psychological/mental
FS.linkedContent: [for deconstruction] history of the work is not only its past, it is the impossibility of the text ever being present > legitimating intention keeps to internal truth, avoids thinking a subjective origin that is not simply psychological/mental

FS.content: Proust’s aesthetic/critical method not outside the work, but heart of its creation > the end of the book engenders its beginning (Derrida compares Proust to Hegel)
FS.linkedContent: Proust’s aesthetic/critical method not outside the work, but heart of its creation > the end of the book engenders its beginning (Derrida compares Proust to Hegel)

FS.content: Nietzsche against Flaubert for believing in the work over the man (sedentary life), we would have to choose btwn writing and dance: dance of the pen? but we must hunch to write
FS.linkedContent: Nietzsche against Flaubert for believing in the work over the man (sedentary life), we would have to choose btwn writing and dance: dance of the pen? but we must hunch to write

TB.content: vis-à-vis Benjamin, if structure of the work is “sur-vival,” a strange debt that doesn’t bind anyone to anyone: debt not engaged w/ subject-author but to formal law in immanence of original text
TB.linkedContent: vis-à-vis Benjamin, if structure of the work is “sur-vival,” a strange debt that doesn’t bind anyone to anyone: debt not engaged w/ subject-author but to formal law in immanence of original text

REST.content: what revenue, what surplus value is unleashed, what ghost step (pas de revenant) still comes to haunt the shoe’s in their painting truth (the annulment of their use-value, their out-of-service dereliction)? [revenue & revenant]
REST.linkedContent: what revenue, what surplus value is unleashed, what ghost step (pas de revenant) still comes to haunt the shoe’s in their painting truth (the annulment of their use-value, their out-of-service dereliction)? [revenue & revenant]

REST.content: Van Gogh’s shoes are out of work because they’re in a work (désoeuvrés en tant qu’ouevre), in the invisible ether of being painted
REST.linkedContent: Van Gogh’s shoes are out of work because they’re in a work (désoeuvrés en tant qu’ouevre), in the invisible ether of being painted

REST.content: Van Gogh’s shoes incur the detachment of metonymy, diplomatic representation, an emissary of being for work, so not at work, etc. (same goes for neck & feet)
REST.linkedContent: Van Gogh’s shoes incur the detachment of metonymy, diplomatic representation, an emissary of being for work, so not at work, etc. (same goes for neck & feet)

REST.content: classically, the “thing” is informed matter, Heidegger asks whether this matter/form couple was secretly constituted around thing as work or product (being-product rather than being-thing) > re: Überfall of matter/form couple, has it fallen on the being-thing or being-product? blosse Ding is thing divested of its being-product: what we must think is the Rest ——if clothing for Kant is parergonal, and if what is proper to representation is the “nude,” what do we make of these “old shoes w/ laces”? > a “pure” supplement? parergon w/out ergon?
REST.linkedContent: classically, the “thing” is informed matter, Heidegger asks whether this matter/form couple was secretly constituted around thing as work or product (being-product rather than being-thing) > re: Überfall of matter/form couple, has it fallen on the being-thing or being-product? blosse Ding is thing divested of its being-product: what we must think is the Rest ——if clothing for Kant is parergonal, and if what is proper to representation is the “nude,” what do we make of these “old shoes w/ laces”? > a “pure” supplement? parergon w/out ergon?

REST.content: Heidegger’s schema (in barely displaced Kantian sense): hybrid, mediation, double-belonging, double articulation > product (Zeug) situated btwn thing & work of art (Werk always that of art in this context), intermediary place (Zwischenstellung), inter-posture (Lacoue-Labarthe), inter-stela
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger’s schema (in barely displaced Kantian sense): hybrid, mediation, double-belonging, double articulation > product (Zeug) situated btwn thing & work of art (Werk always that of art in this context), intermediary place (Zwischenstellung), inter-posture (Lacoue-Labarthe), inter-stela

REST.content: in Heidegger’s Origin both product and work of art produced (hervorgebracht) by hand of man, art resembles thing in its self-sufficient presence, product is more than half thing, less than half work of art
REST.linkedContent: in Heidegger’s Origin both product and work of art produced (hervorgebracht) by hand of man, art resembles thing in its self-sufficient presence, product is more than half thing, less than half work of art

REST.content: work like shoe-picture exhibits what something lacks in order to be a work, exhibits—in shoes—its lack of itself
REST.linkedContent: work like shoe-picture exhibits what something lacks in order to be a work, exhibits—in shoes—its lack of itself

REST.content: what looks like a process of fetishization in Heidegger (uselessness of product at work in work) is, to Heidegger, a strange process of alētheia
REST.linkedContent: what looks like a process of fetishization in Heidegger (uselessness of product at work in work) is, to Heidegger, a strange process of alētheia

REST.content: acc. Heidegger, there’s uselessness in what a painting represents/frames and uselessness in that the painting represents/frames, uselessness due to product’s (shoes’) detachment from milieu by the artifice of its reattachment: the line of the frame > useless in that it’s a work
REST.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, there’s uselessness in what a painting represents/frames and uselessness in that the painting represents/frames, uselessness due to product’s (shoes’) detachment from milieu by the artifice of its reattachment: the line of the frame > useless in that it’s a work

PIO.content: event (also l’oeuvre) calls for new statutes/conventions that could record, account for, such events (neither speech act theory nor literary theory [formalist or hermeneutic variety] can account for such event)
PIO.linkedContent: event (also l’oeuvre) calls for new statutes/conventions that could record, account for, such events (neither speech act theory nor literary theory [formalist or hermeneutic variety] can account for such event)

RM.content: always plus d’une language in the language: the capture of the crossing (croisement) that allies Ziehen and Reissen, this capture (à la fois violent/faithful, laissant sauf) affects the captor, abduction (captation), translation, into other’s language [French retrait, English re-tracing] > all this already at work (à l’oeuvre) in the other’s languages, these dealings make for a work (fait oeuvre)
RM.linkedContent: always plus d’une language in the language: the capture of the crossing (croisement) that allies Ziehen and Reissen, this capture (à la fois violent/faithful, laissant sauf) affects the captor, abduction (captation), translation, into other’s language [French retrait, English re-tracing] > all this already at work (à l’oeuvre) in the other’s languages, these dealings make for a work (fait oeuvre)

RM.content: from “Origin of the Work of Art,” Zug zum Werk (attraction toward the work), work as sumballein, allegoreuein, nonwithdrawal of truth as truth, Un-verborgenheit > truth as originary combat (Urstreit) > a combat that’s an attraction of reciprocal belonging, a Grundriss
RM.linkedContent: from “Origin of the Work of Art,” Zug zum Werk (attraction toward the work), work as sumballein, allegoreuein, nonwithdrawal of truth as truth, Un-verborgenheit > truth as originary combat (Urstreit) > a combat that’s an attraction of reciprocal belonging, a Grundriss

PF.content: a work worthy of the name always opens a virtual university, appeals to a new universal knowledge capable of “reading” it, countersigning it, assuring its tradition
PF.linkedContent: a work worthy of the name always opens a virtual university, appeals to a new universal knowledge capable of “reading” it, countersigning it, assuring its tradition

TR.content: “l’oeuvre has a virtual future only by surviving or cutting itself off from its presumed responsible signatory”
TR.linkedContent: “l’oeuvre has a virtual future only by surviving or cutting itself off from its presumed responsible signatory”

TR.content: “sooner or later,” patience of virtual that stretches time beyond death: promises survival of work, and also survival by the work as self-justification
TR.linkedContent: “sooner or later,” patience of virtual that stretches time beyond death: promises survival of work, and also survival by the work as self-justification

TR.content: passion of [Rousseau’s] faith seals virtual time of work, une oeuvre that will operate by itself, beyond its signatory (w/out [Rousseau’s] living assistance [machine])
TR.linkedContent: passion of [Rousseau’s] faith seals virtual time of work, une oeuvre that will operate by itself, beyond its signatory (w/out [Rousseau’s] living assistance [machine])

TR.content: the work that operates by itself, in quasi-machine like fashion: secret affinity btwn grace & machine, heart & automatism of marionette; re: Rousseau, excusing machine, writing machine
TR.linkedContent: the work that operates by itself, in quasi-machine like fashion: secret affinity btwn grace & machine, heart & automatism of marionette; re: Rousseau, excusing machine, writing machine

TR.content: machine kills time & redeems fault  > grace will operate “sooner or later” by the work of the work at work (in machinelike fashion)
TR.linkedContent: machine kills time & redeems fault > grace will operate “sooner or later” by the work of the work at work (in machinelike fashion)

TR.content: [re: Confessions] l’oeuvre generates/capitalizes a sort of interest (won’t be so bold as to say surplus value) of guilt: overproduces shame that is archived (not effaced)
TR.linkedContent: [re: Confessions] l’oeuvre generates/capitalizes a sort of interest (won’t be so bold as to say surplus value) of guilt: overproduces shame that is archived (not effaced)

TR.content: de Man: never enough guilt to match text-machine’s infinite power to excuse
TR.linkedContent: de Man: never enough guilt to match text-machine’s infinite power to excuse

TR.content: guilt in the act of writing, excuse doesn’t merely accuses: carries out the verdict
TR.linkedContent: guilt in the act of writing, excuse doesn’t merely accuses: carries out the verdict

TR.content: not only accusation & judgment in confession, there’s the executioner (carrying out of the sentence): sentence endured in pleasure of writing, ambiguous enjoyment at heart of terrible, severe jubilation of inscription: one steps up to cashier right away to collect interest on a capital that will assume value only “sooner or later,” after my death, in my absence
TR.linkedContent: not only accusation & judgment in confession, there’s the executioner (carrying out of the sentence): sentence endured in pleasure of writing, ambiguous enjoyment at heart of terrible, severe jubilation of inscription: one steps up to cashier right away to collect interest on a capital that will assume value only “sooner or later,” after my death, in my absence

TR.content: oeuvre as trace implies structure of sur-vival, what cuts the oeuvre off from the operation, cut assures archival independence, quasi-machinelike autonomy: iterability, power of repetition
TR.linkedContent: oeuvre as trace implies structure of sur-vival, what cuts the oeuvre off from the operation, cut assures archival independence, quasi-machinelike autonomy: iterability, power of repetition

TR.content: machine is cut as well as cutting re: living present of life, living body > machine as much effect as cause of cut
TR.linkedContent: machine is cut as well as cutting re: living present of life, living body > machine as much effect as cause of cut

TR.content: machine structurally resembles causa sui, figure of God, question of technical as question of theological: Bergson’s “machine for making gods”
TR.linkedContent: machine structurally resembles causa sui, figure of God, question of technical as question of theological: Bergson’s “machine for making gods”

TR.content: forgiveness & excuse only possible where there’s quasi-machinelike survival of oeuvre
TR.linkedContent: forgiveness & excuse only possible where there’s quasi-machinelike survival of oeuvre

TR.content: oeuvre: (name of) trace of event or institution of this event itself?
TR.linkedContent: oeuvre: (name of) trace of event or institution of this event itself?

TR.content: cut: wounding, opening, chance of a respiration
re: oeuvre as trace of its ambiguity, as if quasi-machine were already operating even before being produced in the world, in the vivid experience of living present
TR.linkedContent: re: oeuvre as trace of its ambiguity, as if quasi-machine were already operating even before being produced in the world, in the vivid experience of living present

AFR.content: Condillac’s corpus vulnerable, open, to violent self-serving operations [e.g. de Biran], innocently called lapses in reading: dissolving alternative opposition [btwn genesis/calculus] because unable to find literal rule of its [system’s working] statement
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac’s corpus vulnerable, open, to violent self-serving operations [e.g. de Biran], innocently called lapses in reading: dissolving alternative opposition [btwn genesis/calculus] because unable to find literal rule of its [system’s working] statement

+R.content: force of trait (disjointed forms a work): systasis of powerful ligatures holds, binds, disjecta membra, ladder is a scaffold, a synonym of POTENCE, garroted, bound (pillars, columns, frames, capitals)
+R.linkedContent: force of trait (disjointed forms a work): systasis of powerful ligatures holds, binds, disjecta membra, ladder is a scaffold, a synonym of POTENCE, garroted, bound (pillars, columns, frames, capitals)

C.content: the topology of the cartouche: parergon (the hors-d’oeuvre’s supplement in the work)
C.linkedContent: the topology of the cartouche: parergon (the hors-d’oeuvre’s supplement in the work)

TN.content: what does privileging one sense exclude, what do the senses exclude? risk losing what the work (l’oeuvre) claims to opens up (prétend donner accès)?
TN.linkedContent: what does privileging one sense exclude, what do the senses exclude? risk losing what the work (l’oeuvre) claims to opens up (prétend donner accès)?

ATM.content: what to make of a signature [Levinas’] when “il aura obligé,” when Il signs in his place?
ATM.linkedContent: what to make of a signature [Levinas’] when “il aura obligé,” when Il signs in his place?

ATM.content: how does one hear “one must” in Derrida’s polysemic “l’oeuvre d’E.L. aura obligé”
ATM.linkedContent: how does one hear “one must” in Derrida’s polysemic “l’oeuvre d’E.L. aura obligé”

ATM.content: how to cite when Levinas places the whole language (French & Western) btwn quotation marks? at same time “he” is in quotation marks: the nameless signatory w/out authorial signature, “he” who undersigns every work, met en oeuvre tout ouvrage
ATM.linkedContent: how to cite when Levinas places the whole language (French & Western) btwn quotation marks? at same time “he” is in quotation marks: the nameless signatory w/out authorial signature, “he” who undersigns every work, met en oeuvre tout ouvrage

ATM.content: [Levinas’ work] a fabrication of quotation marks crocheting a text w/out edge (bordure): seriality irreducibly knots a text to a language
ATM.linkedContent: [Levinas’ work] a fabrication of quotation marks crocheting a text w/out edge (bordure): seriality irreducibly knots a text to a language

ATM.content: [vis-à-vis Levinas] one can no longer think oeuvre in technical or productive order of operation (poiein, facere, agere, tun, wirken, erzeugen)
ATM.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Levinas] one can no longer think oeuvre in technical or productive order of operation (poiein, facere, agere, tun, wirken, erzeugen)

ATM.content: Levinas: the other can always dispossess me of my work
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas: the other can always dispossess me of my work

ATM.content: if a work signifies expenditure (dépense) or pure loss (perte) in a game, it would still be determined by economy
ATM.linkedContent: if a work signifies expenditure (dépense) or pure loss (perte) in a game, it would still be determined by economy

ATM.content: Levinas plays a game that’s not a game, the gratuity of his work, what he still calls liturgy > “it is ethics itself”
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas plays a game that’s not a game, the gratuity of his work, what he still calls liturgy > “it is ethics itself”

BSi.content: exergue (ex-ergon)—like parergon, out of work that puts to work > but like capital too: makes work happen, comes at head (inscribe date)
BSi.linkedContent: exergue (ex-ergon)—like parergon, out of work that puts to work > but like capital too: makes work happen, comes at head (inscribe date)

UWC.content: work of a worker (travailleur) must be recognized as craft/trade/profession in market (a semantics rooted in socio-ideological history dating back to Christian Middle Ages) > when is there an oeuvre? professor’s authority not based on production of oeuvre
UWC.linkedContent: work of a worker (travailleur) must be recognized as craft/trade/profession in market (a semantics rooted in socio-ideological history dating back to Christian Middle Ages) > when is there an oeuvre? professor’s authority not based on production of oeuvre

UWC.content: not every travail an event in itself, doesn’t always produce an oeuvre, not every performative (always authorized by an institutional “as if”) produces oeuvre
UWC.linkedContent: not every travail an event in itself, doesn’t always produce an oeuvre, not every performative (always authorized by an institutional “as if”) produces oeuvre

UWC.content: Kant sees philosophy (in university) neither as performative nor as producing oeuvre, but professor of philosophy has total freedom > speaks publicly, but only inside university
UWC.linkedContent: Kant sees philosophy (in university) neither as performative nor as producing oeuvre, but professor of philosophy has total freedom > speaks publicly, but only inside university

UWC.content: techno-scientific virtualization of work, the putting-into-common, any “community” [Aristotle’s city] > mutation of taking place of event, of oeuvre—that which arrives
UWC.linkedContent: techno-scientific virtualization of work, the putting-into-common, any “community” [Aristotle’s city] > mutation of taking place of event, of oeuvre—that which arrives

UWC.content: end of certain figure of professor gives rise to other strategies of “as if,” singular oeuvres > Derrida believes in certain necessity of professoriat
UWC.linkedContent: end of certain figure of professor gives rise to other strategies of “as if,” singular oeuvres > Derrida believes in certain necessity of professoriat

UWC.content: mise en oeuvre (the putting to work), at least to the performative putting to work of “as if”
UWC.linkedContent: mise en oeuvre (the putting to work), at least to the performative putting to work of “as if”

SPEC.content: “literary fiction” in fort:da, fait-oeuvre in abyss of these repetitions, fairies, demons, unheimlich repetitions, what is most gripping (saisissant) and ungraspable (insaisissable) about Beyond…, for Freud too, who believed he could affix the seal of the Freuds to it [Beyond…] while hearing voices
SPEC.linkedContent: “literary fiction” in fort:da, fait-oeuvre in abyss of these repetitions, fairies, demons, unheimlich repetitions, what is most gripping (saisissant) and ungraspable (insaisissable) about Beyond…, for Freud too, who believed he could affix the seal of the Freuds to it [Beyond…] while hearing voices
